taxonConcepts.nameAccordingTo: Species 2000 & ITIS Catalogue of Life: April 2013
IUCN Red List (Species Assessed for Global Conservation)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription
dataObjects.title: Biology
dataObjects.description: Preys on juvenile cichlids on sandy substrate.  Juveniles are very common in near-shore shallow waters, adults found in deeper waters (Ref. 5595).

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#DiagnosticDescription
dataObjects.description: Description: snout shorter than B. rhoadesii (Ref. 55954).Coloration: dark band on lateral line (Ref. 55954).

dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Kazembe, J., Makocho, P. & Mailosi, A. 2006. Buccochromis lepturus. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description:
Red List Category
LC
Least Concern

Red List Criteria

Version
3.1

Year Assessed
2006

Assessor/s
Kazembe, J., Makocho, P. & Mailosi, A.

Reviewer/s
Snoeks, J. (Freshwater Fish Red List Authority) & Darwall, W. (Freshwater Biodiversity Assessment Programme)

Contributor/s

Justification
Endemic to Lake Malawi and Lake Malombe with a wide distribution. A population decline is reported due to heavy fishing in the southern arms of Lake Malawi and in Lake Malombe but the decline is currently not thought to exceed 30% in the last 10 years.
